intro: Argyrolobium pauciflorum var. semiglabrum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered silverlobium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and has a bushy growth habit. The variety semiglabrum is distinguished by its reduced pubescence, giving the plant a smoother appearance compared to other varieties.
